Yes, here in the sylvan retreat,</br>Where innocence carelessly strays,</br>Simplicity fixes her seat,</br>And numberless beauties displays.
How sweet are the nymphs in her train,</br>While Modesty leads them along;</br>How pleasing the notes of the swain,</br>Who warbles her elegant song!
The arbours that wave in the gale,</br>The warblers that sing on the boughs;</br>The flowrets that bloom in the dale,</br>The stream that enchantingly flows;
The grotto's impervious glooms,</br>Where thick-throbbing terror alarms;</br>The rock where the jessamine blooms,</br>Acquire from her beauty their charms.
Her manner is soft and refin'd,</br>She's free from affected disguise;</br>She's gentle, she's friendly, she's kind,</br>And sympathy beams in her eyes.
She's deck'd in the garments of ease,</br>She smiles with an innocent air,</br>With sweetness that always must please,</br>With softness becoming the fair.
Would Chloris more lovely appear,</br>And beauty's bright graces improve;</br>These magical robes let her wear,</br>And yield to the impulse of love.
Would Damon to glory aspire,</br>And swell with true ardour the strain,</br>Simplicity's charms must inspire,</br>And soften the breast of the swain.</br>
